attributes.action: speak out re demonisation of Israel in Uk
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
demonise: portray as evil.
      
Israel is repeatedly demonised … by MPs, media & UK groups (trade unions, academia, medical bodies, journalist groups - even architects – seeking boycotts).
It’s ok to criticize, but singling out & applying unique standards turns demonic. 
The deafening silence of those outspoken on Israel on ‘similar issues’ shows more than criticism. e.g. boycotts groups don’t fault countries with far worse human rights records than Israel could be accused of. They cite occupation– yet don’t consider acting against other occupiers e.g. Britain. 
Demonisation warps the conflict, is an obstacle to peace, refutes UK reputation of moral fairness, serves those who justify terror & does nothing to halt increasing anti-Semitism. 
Blair put Israel in group of ‘others’ after 7/7: “attack was carried out by Islamic terrorists responsible for many deaths in Madrid, Bali, S. Arabia, Russia, Kenya, Tanzania, Pakistan, Yemen, Turkey, Egypt & Morocco and, of course NY but in many other countries too…” 
Omitting Israel was a moral travesty, rewriting history, insulting to terror victims & rewarding those who demonize Israel.
